text: Robert Dean Ferry (May 31, 1937 â€“ October 27, 2021) was an American professional basketball player, assistant coach, and general manager (GM) in the National Basketball Association (NBA). He was born in St. Louis, Missouri. He played for the St. Louis Hawks (1959-1960), Detroit Pistons (1960-1964) and the Baltimore Bullets (1964-1968). He was an executive of the Washington Bullets and was in charge when the team won the 1978 NBA Finals.
